page.title: 01THE BLOCK AS A WHOLE
page.content:
{NOTE The survey work undertaken for {the Domesday Project was confined to a {2 by 4 kilometre block: we started at {the correct south west corner but were {unable to do any work on the {northernmost 1 by 4 km strip.
This area is characterised by high rounded hills, most of which are covered by conifers owned by the Forestry Commission. The rest of the land is given to farming: mainly sheep but with some cattle too. Geologically the land is sand-stone coal measures. There are three villages inside the block: {TONMAWR}in the Pelenna Valley and the twin villages of{CYNNONVILLE} and{DYFFRYN RHONDDA}which are in the Afan Valley.
